results.title: The Kauri
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Outlines the destruction done to the New Zealand Kauri forests at the end of the century. The forests were plundered for the wood, the highly profitable resinous gum and the land. Due to careful replanting programs and selective tree felling, the forests are now slowly increasing and there are strong hopes of a future for the giant Kauri tree.

results.title: The Karri forest
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A tall karri forest in south-west of Western Australia is part of the State’s third of a million acres of forest. It provides a continuous and increasing supply for the timber industry; and is the site of a youth camp for school children. Forest officers explain various aspects of forestry to the children showing felling, milling and fire control. Other attractions include rare wildflowers, reptiles and birds.

results.title: The Karate kid. Part 3
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Jerry Weintraub and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Hoping for a life of peace and tranquility selling bonsais, Daniel and Mr. Miyagi once again find themselves up against the odds. Going against Mr. Miyagi’s wishes, Daniel will defend his title in an All-Valley Championship match arranged by his nemesis, Kreese, whose karate studio folded after his star pupil lost to Daniel. This time Daniel must face ‘the bad boy of karate,’ Mike Barnes. When Mr. Miyagi refuses to train Daniel for the tournament, Daniel inevitably falls into the clutches of Terry (Kreese’s friend, unbeknownst to Daniel), who takes him on as a karate student. Cast includes: Ralph Macchio, Noriyuki Morita, Robyn Lively, Thomas Ian Griffith and Martin Kove.

results.title: The Karate kid. Part 2
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen and Jerry Weintraub
results.brief_description: Karate kid, Daniel travels to Japan with his teacher, Miyagi, to visit Miyagi’s dying father. It’s a troubled trip for Daniel and his teacher as Miyagi returns to face his sworn enemy. Daniel becomes involved in the hate-ridden vendetta and whereas before he fought in a contest where a trophy was at stake, Daniel now plays a game that’s a fight to the death.

results.title: The Karate Kid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Jerry Weintraub and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Daniel, a fatherless teenager, arrives in Los Angeles from the East Coast and faces the difficult task of making new friends. He becomes the object of bullying by a menacing gang of karate students, the Cobras, when he strikes up a relationship with the leader’s ex-girlfriend, Ali. Daniel’s handyman, Miyagi, a master of martial arts, teaches him karate and that fighting is always a last answer to a problem. Daniel learns that karate is a mastery over the self, mind and body, and develops physical skills as well as faith and self confidence.

results.title: The Kangaroos
results.creator_credit: Peter Du Cane and David Moore
results.brief_description: An amazingly diverse group of marsupials, the kangaroos range from small hare-wallabies and curious tree dwelling kangaroos in the Queensland rainforests, to the great Red, Euro and Grey Kangaroos of the plains, hills and forests. The behaviour of these and other kangaroos is the subject of this program.

results.title: The Kandy Perahera
results.brief_description: The Perahera that takes place in Sri Lanka, is one of the most magnificent torchlight pageants in the world. Known as the Festival of the August Moon, the Kandy Perahera is held annually in the lunar month of Esala (July/August) in the hill capital of Kandy, stronghold of the proud Sinhala Kings for over 20 centuries, and Sri Lanka’s most beautiful city. This video captures an impression of the visual splendour and exciting atmosphere of a pageant that includes up to 1200 elephants with an animated cast of thousands.

results.title: The Kami
results.brief_description: About the vanishing art of making a water powered lathe. Its use is demonstrated by the manufacture of traditional wooden water jugs by a villager in Nepal.

results.title: The Kalahari desert people
results.creator_credit: John Marshall, Robert Young, Nicholas Clapp, Dennis B. Kane and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Examines the social and cultural changes being made by the bushmen of southern Africa’s Kalahari Desert as modern influences change traditional patterns of living and they become farmer-herders after thousands of years of being hunter-gatherers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Marshall, Robert Young, Nicholas Clapp, Dennis B. Kane and National Geographic Society
